intro: Calcarunia hastata, commonly known as the slender rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, elongated leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers with four petals, typical of the mustard family. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or arctic environments. Calcarunia hastata is known for its ability to survive in harsh, cold climates and is often used in ecological restoration projects.
